text: Levi Parsons Morton (May 16, 1824 â€“ May 16, 1920) was a U.S. representative from New York and the 22nd vice president of the United States. He also later served as the 31st Governor of New York. Morton died on his 96th birthday at his home in Rhinebeck, New York on May 16, 1920 from bronchopneumonia. At 96, Levi Morton was the longest lived Vice President of the United States until 1964, when he was surpassed by John Nance Garner. ==References== Category:1824 births Category:1920 deaths Category:Deaths from bronchopneumonia Category:Governors of New York (state) Category:United States representatives from New York (state) Category:19th-century American politicians Category:Businesspeople from Vermont Category:Politicians from Vermont Category:Businesspeople from New York (state) Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Ambassadors of the United States to France Category:Vice presidents of the United States
